ai.summary: A challenging 17.9 km day hike in the UK along the Lamer & Ayot St Lawrence route. Expect varied rural terrain and several uphill sections, best attempted by experienced hikers with good navigation and preparation.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied rural terrain: grassy fields and hedged footpaths, occasional stiles and gates, and short country-road sections. Ground can be uneven and muddy after rain; expect ascents and uneven footing in places.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long, hard hike: check weather and daylight, wear sturdy boots, and bring navigation tools. Stay on public paths, close gates, and watch for livestock. Carry adequate water and food, a basic first aid kit, a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a whistle for emergencies. Let someone know your route and expected return time. Be prepared for sudden weather changes in the UK.
recommended_gear: Fully charged phone with offline mapping
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–October) for milder weather and longer daylight; winter hikes require extra preparation and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Lamer & Ayot St Lawrence Hike – 17.9 km Hard Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Lamer & Ayot St Lawrence hike in the UK. A challenging 17.9 km route with rural paths, gates, and varied terrain. Safety tips and gear guidance for experienced hikers.
seo.h1: Lamer & Ayot St Lawrence – 17.9 km Hard UK Hiking Route
